      • parseArguments

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> parseArguments(java.util.List<java.lang.String> argsList)
                                                throws AbstractApplicationException,
                                                       ShellException
        Handle quoting + globing + command substitution for a list of arguments.
        Parameters:
        argsList - The original list of arguments.
        Returns:
        The list of parsed arguments.
        Throws:
        ShellException - If any of the arguments have an invalid syntax.
        AbstractApplicationException

      • resolveOneArgument

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> resolveOneArgument(java.lang.String arg)
                                                    throws AbstractApplicationException,
                                                           ShellException
        Unwraps single and double quotes from one argument. Performs globing when there are unquoted asterisks. Performs command substitution.

        Single quotes disable the interpretation of all special characters. Double quotes disable the interpretation of all special characters, except for back quotes.

        Parameters:
        arg - String containing one argument.
        Returns:
        A list containing one or more parsed args, depending on the outcome of the parsing.
        Throws:
        AbstractApplicationException
        ShellException

      • appendParsedArgIntoSegment

        private void appendParsedArgIntoSegment(java.util.LinkedList<RegexArgument> parsedArgsSegment,
                                        RegexArgument parsedArg)
        Append current parsedArg to the last parsedArg in parsedArgsSegment. If parsedArgsSegment is empty, then just add current parsedArg.
